flawed_nl_solution:
She has 3 hens that lay 3 eggs a day so they lay 3*3 = <<3*3=9>>9 eggs a day
The hens lay 9 eggs a day and she wasn't able to collect them for 7 days so that means there are 9*7 = <<9*7=36>>36 eggs
Her neighbor took 12 off the 36 eggs so that leaves 36-12 = <<36-12=24>>24 eggs
Myrtle dropped 5 of the remaining 24 eggs so she has 24-5 = <<24-5=19>>19 eggs
#### 19

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 63, not 36. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
